name: create_typescript_definitions_for_project
description:
Generates TypeScript types for a project.

This function generates TypeScript type definitions for a project, identified
by its `project_id`. It processes the project information to produce a
string containing the TypeScript types.

name: enumerate_all_user_projects
description:
Lists all Supabase projects for the user.

This function lists all Supabase projects for the user. It helps discover
the project ID of the project that the user is working on.

name: enumerate_project_branches
description:
Lists all development branches of a Supabase project.

Lists all development branches of a Supabase project. This function returns
branch details including status which can be used to check when
operations like merge, rebase, or reset complete.

parent_project_ref.description: The unique identifier for the project.

name: enumerate_project_edge_functions
description:
Lists all Edge Functions in a Supabase project.

This function lists all Edge Functions available within a specified Supabase project.
For each Edge Function, it provides comprehensive details including its unique
identifier, slug, display name, current version, operational status, and
timestamps indicating its creation and last update.

project_reference_for_functions.description: The identifier of the Supabase project.

name: establish_development_branch
description:
Creates a development branch on a Supabase project.

This function creates a development branch on a Supabase project. It applies all migrations
from the main project to a fresh branch database. Production data will not carry over.
The branch receives its own project_id via the resulting project_ref, which should be
used to execute queries and migrations on the branch.

branch_cost_approval_id.description: The cost confirmation ID. Call `confirm_cost` first.

new_branch_label.description: Name of the branch to create. Defaults to "develop".

name: execute_schema_migration
description:
Applies a migration to the database.

Applies a migration to the database. Use this when executing DDL operations.
Do not hardcode references to generated IDs in data migrations.

migration_identifier_name.description: The name of the migration in snake_case.

name: fetch_installed_database_extensions
description:
Lists all extensions in the database.

This function lists all extensions in the database associated with the specified project.

name: fetch_project_information
description:
Gets details for a Supabase project.

Gets details for a Supabase project. This function retrieves information
for a project identified by its unique ID.

name: fetch_public_api_key
description:
Gets the anonymous API key for a project.

This function gets the anonymous API key for a project.

name: fetch_user_organizations
description:
Lists all organizations that the user is a member of.

This function retrieves a list of all organizations of which the user is a member.

name: get_all_database_migrations
description:
Lists all migrations in the database.

This function lists all migrations in the database associated with the provided project_id.

name: get_database_tables_by_schema
description:
Lists all tables in one or more schemas.

This function lists all tables found within one or more specified schemas for a given project.
If the `schemas` parameter is not provided, it defaults to listing tables from all available schemas
associated with the `project_id`.

target_schema_names.description: List of schemas to include. Defaults to all schemas if None.

name: integrate_branch_into_production
description:
Merges migrations and edge functions from a development branch to production.

This function processes the branch identified by `branch_id` to merge its
associated migrations and edge functions into the production environment.
It returns a dictionary detailing the status of this merge operation.

source_branch_id_for_merge.description: The ID of the development branch to be merged.

name: provision_supabase_project
description:
Creates a new Supabase project.

Creates a new Supabase project. Always ask the user which organization to create the project in.
The project can take a few minutes to initialize - use `get_project` to check the status.

parent_organization_id.description: The ID of the organization to create the project in.

cost_confirmation_token.description: The cost confirmation ID. Call `confirm_cost` first.

deployment_region_name.description:
The region to create the project in. Defaults to the closest region.
Possible values: "us-west-1", "us-east-1", "us-east-2", "ca-central-1",
"eu-west-1", "eu-west-2", "eu-west-3", "eu-central-1", "eu-central-2",
"eu-north-1", "ap-south-1", "ap-southeast-1", "ap-northeast-1",
"ap-northeast-2", "ap-southeast-2", "sa-east-1". Defaults to None.

name: publish_edge_function_version
description:
Deploys an Edge Function to a Supabase project.

This function deploys an Edge Function to a specified Supabase project.
If the function already exists within the project, this operation will create
a new version of that function.

deployment_target_project_id.description: The identifier of the Supabase project.

content.description: The string content of the file.

source_file_collection.description:
The files to upload. This should include the
entrypoint and any relative dependencies. Each dictionary in the list
represents a file and must contain the following keys:

main_executable_file_path.description:
The entrypoint of the function.
Defaults to "index.ts".

dependency_import_map_location.description:
The import map for the function.
Defaults to None.

name: reactivate_paused_project
description:
Restores a Supabase project.

This function restores a Supabase project. It uses the provided project ID
to identify the project to be restored.

name: remove_development_branch
description:
Deletes a development branch.

This function deletes a specific development branch. The branch to be deleted
is identified by the provided `branch_id`.

branch_identifier_to_delete.description: The ID of the branch to be deleted.

name: retrieve_organization_details
description:
Gets details for an organization. Includes subscription plan.

Gets details for an organization. Includes subscription plan.

name: retrieve_project_api_endpoint
description:
Gets the API URL for a project.

This function gets the API URL for a project.

project_ref_for_url.description: The unique identifier of the project.

name: retrieve_service_logs
description:
Gets logs for a Supabase project by service type.

This function retrieves logs for a specified Supabase project, filtered by service type,
to aid in debugging application issues. It only returns logs generated within the
last minute. If logs older than one minute are required, the actions or tests
that produce these logs should be re-run to capture them.

log_source_project_id.description: The ID of the Supabase project.

log_service_category.description:
The service to fetch logs for. Must be one of 'api',
'branch-action', 'postgres', 'edge-function', 'auth', 'storage',
'realtime'.

name: revert_branch_to_migration_version
description:
Resets migrations of a development branch.

Resets migrations of a development branch. Any untracked data or schema
changes will be lost.

target_branch_id_for_reset.description: The ID of the development branch to be reset.

target_migration_checkpoint.description:
Reset your development branch to a
specific migration version.

name: run_raw_sql_query
description:
Executes raw SQL in the Postgres database. Use `apply_migration` instead for DDL operations.

This function simulates PostgreSQL query execution for the Supabase API simulation.
All operations are performed in-memory with no persistence between sessions.

Supported SQL Operations:
- SELECT queries with WHERE, JOIN, GROUP BY, HAVING, ORDER BY, LIMIT
- INSERT statements (single and multiple rows)
- UPDATE statements with WHERE conditions
- DELETE statements with WHERE conditions
- Basic DDL: CREATE TABLE, ALTER TABLE, DROP TABLE
- Transaction commands: BEGIN, COMMIT, ROLLBACK
- Multi-schema support (e.g., public.users, analytics.products)

Supported Data Types:
- Text types: TEXT, VARCHAR, CHAR
- Numeric types: INTEGER, BIGINT, SMALLINT, DECIMAL, NUMERIC, REAL, DOUBLE
- Boolean: BOOLEAN
- Date/Time: DATE, TIME, TIMESTAMP, TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE
- UUID (stored as VARCHAR internally)
- JSON/JSONB (stored as JSON)
- SERIAL/BIGSERIAL types (converted to INTEGER/BIGINT, auto-increment not supported)

PostgreSQL Compatibility Notes:
- SERIAL/BIGSERIAL columns are converted to INTEGER/BIGINT (manual ID management required)
- PostgreSQL functions like now() and uuid_generate_v4() are automatically converted
- Foreign key constraints across different schemas are not supported
- Type OIDs in responses are approximated based on common PostgreSQL types

Limitations of this simulation:
- PostgreSQL-specific functions are limited (e.g., array functions, full-text search)
- Advanced features like CTEs and window functions have limited support
- Stored procedures, functions, and triggers are not supported
- PostgreSQL extensions (postgis, pg_trgm, etc.) are not available
- Transaction isolation levels are not enforced
- Constraints are partially supported (PRIMARY KEY works, CHECK constraints work, but foreign keys have limitations)
- No support for COPY, VACUUM, ANALYZE, or other maintenance commands
- Limited support for advanced index types (only basic indexes work)
- Sequences and auto-increment functionality not available
- User-defined types and domains are not supported

name: suspend_project_activity
description:
Pauses a Supabase project.

Pauses a Supabase project.

target_project_to_pause.description: The ID of the project to pause.

name: update_branch_with_production_changes
description:
Rebases a development branch on production.

The function effectively runs any newer migrations from production onto this
branch to help handle migration drift.

branch_ref_to_rebase.description: The unique identifier of the branch to be rebased.
